result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke J Berenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit for 84 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs and Surcharge.  Paid in full.  Refund balance of bail to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Inform treatment providers.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke J Berenz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant regarding charge dropped and DMV (2-9-15, Per case manager, report sent to DOT on 10-14-15)
dated Feb 2, 2016 response to defendant's Feb 1, 2016 Inmate Communication

ADDRESS INFO for Luke J Berenz
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail.,   (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: N165w20553 Berry Patch Rd, Jackson, WI 53037
dated 1/28/2016, filed by Luke Berenz.

Defendant Luke J Berenz in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1, repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Pyzyk makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 months without work release.  (Credit - 84 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Inform treatment providers 
Maintain/Obtain employment;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
FINE or COSTS:  $243.00  Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Remainder of the bail to be refunded to the poster.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Roger C. Pyzyk in court.   Defendant Luke J Berenz did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Court waives the video conference.  Attorney Pyzyk makes statements.  Court sets this case for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am. If OTP is necessary, Attorney Pyzyk is to notify the Court 10 days prior to the next court date.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Based on verification of the location of the defendant from WCS
Based on non complaince with WCS, Bail Jumping charges stemming from 2015CT549, Branch 12 Only
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Luke J Berenz in court, in custody, with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The program the defendant was supposed to start has been canceled and he will be scheduled for another program at MSDF.  Defense requests further proceedings date in August.  Defendant to appear by video for the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Luke J Berenz in court, in custody, with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant expects to report to MSDF on 6/18/15.  Court will schedule a further proceedings after that date.  Defendant may appear by video.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Luke J Berenz in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
